summary: This is a Bank of America credit card statement for a Cash Rewards account covering the period December 6, 2018, to January 5, 2019. It shows routine transactions, interest charges, and promotional information about cash back rewards, with no direct mention of Epstein-related individuals, events, or locations. This document is a Bank of America credit card statement for a Cash Rewards account covering January 6 to February 5, 2019. It shows transactions primarily at retail stores and restaurants in Brooklyn, NY, and details promotional balance transfer and cash advance offers. The statement includes standard credit card terms, payment information, and interest calculations. This document is a Bank of America credit card statement for a Cash Rewards account covering the period February 6 to March 5, 2019. It shows transactions, payments, interest charges, and details of promotional offers, including a 0% APR offer on balance transfers and cash advances. The statement reveals spending at various merchants and payments made from a checking account. This document is a Bank of America credit card statement for an account holder, covering transactions from March 6 to April 5, 2019. It shows purchases, fees, interest charges, and details of promotional offers. The statement includes transactions for travel (Delta Air flights between JFK/STI and POP/JFK) and various other purchases in New York and London. This document is a Bank of America credit card statement for an account holder, covering the billing period from April 6 to May 5, 2019. It details account activity, including transactions, fees, and interest charges, and contains standard credit card terms and conditions. The statement shows purchases in New York and the Dominican Republic, along with foreign transaction fees. This document contains two consecutive monthly credit card statements (May-June and June-July 2019) for a Bank of America Cash Rewards account. It shows transactions, payments, and balances, with purchases primarily in Brooklyn, NY, and one in London. The account holder is not named in this excerpt. This document consists of two consecutive monthly credit card statements (July-August 2019 and August-September 2019) for a Bank of America Cash Rewards account. It shows transactions primarily in Brooklyn, NY, and Parsippany, NJ, including payments, purchases, fees, and interest charges. The statements are part of the Epstein case financial document release.
